Empires & Puzzles Diaochan Hero Review & Strategy Guide
She was the queen of speed and theft. Diaochan's fast healing and sticky fingers made her a legend, but can the original sorceress still compete in a world of unstoppable power creep?
Diaochan: The Fast-Healing Kleptomaniac of the Three Kingdoms

Diaochan, the "Brilliant Beauty" from the War of Three Kingdoms event, burst onto the scene in 2022 as a premier support hero. As a Fast mana Purple healer, she filled a massive void in the Dark roster, which historically lacked speed in the healing department. Her unique gimmick—minions that steal buffs—made her an instant nuisance in raids and wars. While she has since received a costume that significantly boosts her power, this review focuses on her base form. Does the original sorceress still have enough magic to charm her way into your team, or has she been left in the dust by her own fashionable alter-ego?

Diaochan’s artwork perfectly captures her "Brilliant Beauty" title. She is depicted with elegance and grace, clad in flowing purple and blue robes that emphasize her role as a Dark healer. The design is intricate, with gold accents and a pose that suggests she is casting a spell—or perhaps reaching out to snatch your favorite buff. It’s a classic, high-fantasy aesthetic that stands out even among the crowded Three Kingdoms roster. Compared to her costume, which leans heavily into a floral theme, the base art feels a bit more regal and focused on her sorcery.

Let's be blunt: by 2026 standards, base Diaochan's stats are showing their age. With a power of 835 and stats hovering around the 800 mark, she falls significantly behind modern heroes who regularly push 1200+ power and 1300+ stats. She is fragile. In today's meta of massive slash attacks and nuclear special skills, she is at risk of being one-shot before she can even fire. However, her class (Sorcerer) allows her to potentially delay enemy mana generation, which can be a lifesaver if she survives long enough to use it.
"Lady's Charm" is a skill that defined a meta.
Recovering 35% health at Fast speed is still excellent. It allows her to stabilize a team quickly, often before the enemy can land a killing blow.
These "Lackey Minions" are the core of her kit. They are relatively fragile (16% HP), but their utility is unmatched.
Every time a minion hits, it steals a dispellable buff. This is incredibly disruptive. It doesn't just remove the buff (dispel); it gives it to
. Stealing a Taunt, a Dodge, or a massive Defense Up can completely swing a match.

The main drawback of the base version compared to the costume is the lack of "Unstoppable" minions. Base Diaochan's minions can be blocked, removed, or disabled by anti-minion heroes like Grimble, Topaz, or the Lunar New Year heroes.

Fast. She charges in 8 tiles. With a level 29 Magic/Styx troop or a level 23 Mana troop (plus her Sorcerer +4% mana node), she charges in 7 tiles. This 7-tile breakpoint is critical for her effectiveness.
35% of a modern hero's HP (approx 2500) is ~875 HP. It's a solid chunk of health, delivered quickly.
With roughly 1600 HP after emblems and Limit Break, a 16% minion has ~256 HP. This is "paper-thin" in the current meta and will vanish from a single slash attack or light AoE.
3 minions x 1 hit per turn = 3 stolen buffs per turn. Over a few turns, this can strip an entire enemy team of their advantages.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Kingdom family bonus is a nice cherry on top, especially if you run other Three Kingdoms heroes.

The Kingdom family bonus provides Mana and Healing every time a minion is summoned. Since Diaochan summons minions for herself and neighbors, this triggers 3 times. If paired with other Kingdom heroes, the mana gain can be significant, helping her cycle her special skill even faster. The morale boost in War of Three Kingdoms is a fixed stat increase, which helps patch up her aging stats slightly during that specific event.
Base Diaochan sadly lacks the powerful "Unstoppable Minions" passive found on her costume. She relies entirely on her special skill and class talent.

. This is arguably the worst Aether power for a pure support healer. Diaochan does not deal direct damage. While the Attack Up technically increases the damage of her minions and her tile damage, it does nothing to help her survivability or her healing output. This is a major disappointment for the base version.

Upon release, Diaochan was a top-tier tank and flank. She was everywhere in the top 100, frustrating players with her speed and sticky fingers. She was the answer to the heavy buff meta of the time (Ludwig, Krampus).

The game has moved on. Her stats are low, and minion counters are abundant. The release of her own Costume, which is strictly better in every way (stats, passive, minion strength), has rendered the base version obsolete for anyone lucky enough to have the costume.

Base Diaochan is no longer a primary defense hero. However, she remains a potent offense hero for war depth. Her fast cleanse/steal is still a unique mechanic that can dismantle specific teams relying on buffs like Taunt or Dodge, provided you can keep her alive.
This is a "Hydrogen Bomb vs. Coughing Baby" scenario.
The Costume has significantly higher base stats (approx +250 power difference).
The Costume has the "Unstoppable Minions" passive, making her minions immune to removal and disable effects. Base Diaochan's minions die to a stiff breeze or get eaten by Grimble.
Base is Sorcerer (Mana Delay); Costume is Cleric (Manashield). Cleric is generally preferred for healers to ensure they fire.
Costume minions are beefier (33% vs 16%) and hit harder.

If you have the costume, you use the costume. There is almost zero reason to use the base form unless you desperately need the Sorcerer class for a specific quest trial. The base hero is essentially a stepping stone to the costume.
Since Diaochan is a healer and support hero with low base defense, survivability is paramount.
Maximizes her chances of surviving a sniper hit to cast her heal. Increases the HP of her minions slightly (since minion HP is % of caster Max HP).
Prioritizes HP to make minions slightly beefier.
Lower Defense stat makes Diaochan herself softer.
path is recommended. Her minions in base form are weak regardless of path; keeping Diaochan alive to fire a second time is more valuable than marginally stronger minions.
35% heal at Fast speed is always relevant.
Turning an enemy's strength (Taunt, Dodge) into your own is a game-winning mechanic.
Excellent synergy with other minion summoners and Kingdom family heroes.
16% HP minions are easily destroyed in the modern meta.
Unlike her costume, base Diaochan gets wrecked by Grimble, Topaz, Bera, and Lunar heroes.
She is squishy and can be killed before firing.
Surgical strikes against buff-heavy teams (e.g., stealing a Ludwig taunt).
She is a queen here, stealing buffs and adding minions (which count as a buff for many effects).
Essential for cleanups or attacking specific teams where you need fast healing.
Diaochan needs protection to shine. Pair her with heroes that can keep her alive or boost her minions.
. Freya boosts Diaochan's weak minions. Pengi capitalizes on the number of minions for massive damage.
. Xnolphod increases mana generation, making Diaochan functionally Very Fast.
Grimble, Topaz, Eloise, and Gobbler destroy her minions instantly, removing her utility.
Lunar heroes (like Laohu) disable her minion effects completely.
Heroes who prevent buffs (like Mist) stop her from gaining the stolen buffs.

If you pulled Diaochan early, congratulations! She will be your main healer for a long time. Prioritize her leveling. Even without the costume, Fast healing is a game-changer for map stages and early raids.

Base Diaochan is a relic. If you don't have the costume, she's a risky play in top-tier wars. She serves best as a specialized counter-pick against teams that rely on slow, undispellable buffs, provided you can shield her. Do not limit break her (especially 2LB) unless you have the costume.
"She is the most coveted one in this portal. This hero is going to shift the buff heavy defence meta overnight."
- A prescient comment from her launch in 2022.
"I prefer Xno out of that group but I use him on both offense and defense because we use purple tanks a lot."
- Comparing her to the then-king Xnolphod.
"The stealing is overrated and she could be hard to use against certain teams like stall."
- A more critical take on her utility.

Base Diaochan is like a classic sports car: beautiful, fast, and iconic, but lacking the safety features and raw horsepower of modern machines. She introduced a mechanic that changed the game, but time (and power creep) has caught up to her. While she can still perform magic in the right hands, she lives entirely in the shadow of her "Unstoppable" costumed self. If you have her, cherish her, but pray for that costume key.
A vintage star, still playable on offense, but retired from serious defense duty.
